Summary I have an extensive background in Management, Sales and Leadership positions. I have a demonstrated ability to facilitate a company's growth by improving Operations and Standard Operating Procedures.

Specialties: Management, Training and Developing, Sales, Leadership and Supervising Experience IVP Intern- Technical Account Manager Oracle June 2015  – Present (3 months) Dallas/Fort Worth Area Retail Asset Manager Amtel LLC February 2012  –  November 2012  (10 months) Addison, TX Store Manager The Customer Center December 2009  –  January 2011  (1 year 2 months) Responsible for maintaining current account base as well as creating and reaching out for new Individual and Corporate Accounts with Sprint. Responsible for over $200,000 worth of daily inventory and cash amounts of up to $5,000 per day. Managing a team of 7 sales reps and Asst Manager. Operations Manager LA Fitness November 2008  –  December 2009  (1 year 2 months) Arlington, TX -Responsible for the management, upkeep and replacement of a facility valued over $10 Million Dollars.  
-Responsible for welfare and experience of over 4,000 members 
-Promoted and coordinated safety policies resulting in no injuries or violations. 
-Supervised and developed staff of over 20 consisting of Fitness Staff, Club Pride and Kid's Staff including the hire and dismissal of staff. 
 
 
TRAINING: 
-Oversaw training of all new staff members and re-training of current staff of fitness facility, consisting of over 20 employees. 
-Overseeing the professional development of entire team, leadingto 2 of my staff members already being promoted to Manager level in just 6 months as a manager. Section Leader U.S. Army March 2003  –  December 2009  (6 years 10 months) Fort Hood, TX- Fort McNair, DC Supervised the health, morale, welfare, physical fitness and training of 4-8 team members. 
-Evaluated and facilitated the professional development of a 4 man team, leading to multiple promotions and awards. 
-Promoted and coordinated safety policies resulting in no injuries or violations in a 3 year period. 
 
 
TRAINING: 
-Conducted live combat MOUT Operations in Iraq clearing over 100 buildings and took charge of Sensitive Site Exploitation. 
-Integrated a rigorous physical fitness program, leading to a team average of 290 out of a possible 300 score on the physical fitness test. 
-Successfully trained platoon on land navigation in a MOUT environment. 
-Trained a 4 man team to qualify expert on assigned weapons, and led the team to perfect execution of live fire exercises.
